name: Iliac crest — Anterior approach
text: Iliac crest anterior approach: superficial interval between TFL/gluteal muscles and external oblique. Structure at risk: lateral femoral cutaneous nerve (LFCN).

name: Iliac crest — Posterior approach
text: Iliac crest posterior approach: superficial interval through gluteus maximus and latissimus dorsi with spinal erector muscles. Structures at risk: superior cluneal nerves, sciatic nerve, superior gluteal artery.

name: Pelvis/acetabulum — Anterior (ilioinguinal)
text: Ilioinguinal approach: superficial interval between external oblique and inguinal ligament; deep interval divides internal oblique. Structures at risk: LFCN, spermatic cord, inferior epigastric artery, femoral artery and nerve.

name: Pelvis/acetabulum — Posterior (Kocher-Langenbeck)
text: Kocher-Langenbeck approach: superficial interval divides gluteus maximus and IT band; deep interval between piriformis and gluteus medius. Structures at risk: sciatic nerve, superior/inferior gluteal nerve and artery, medial femoral circumflex artery (MFCA).

name: Hip — Anterior (Smith-Peterson)
text: Smith-Peterson approach: superficial interval between sartorius and TFL; deep interval between rectus femoris and gluteus medius. Structures at risk: LFCN, femoral nerve/artery, superficial iliac circumflex artery, LFCA (ascending branch).

name: Hip — Anterolateral (Watson-Jones)
text: Watson-Jones approach: superficial interval between TFL and gluteus medius; deep interval splits gluteus medius. Structures at risk: femoral nerve/artery, superior gluteal nerve, LFCA (descending branch).

name: Hip — Lateral (Hardinge)
text: Hardinge approach: superficial interval splits IT band; deep interval divides gluteus medius and vastus lateralis. Structures at risk: superior gluteal nerve, LFCA (transverse branch).

name: Hip — Posterior (Moore/Southern)
text: Posterior hip (Moore/Southern) approach: superficial interval divides gluteus maximus and IT band; deep interval between piriformis/short external rotators and femur. Structures at risk: sciatic nerve, inferior gluteal artery, MFCA.

name: Hip — Medial (Ludloff)
text: Ludloff approach: superficial interval between adductor longus and gracilis; deep interval between adductor brevis and adductor magnus. Structures at risk: obturator nerve, MFCA, deep external pudendal artery.

name: Thigh — Lateral approach
text: Lateral thigh approach: superficial interval divides IT band; deep interval divides or lifts vastus lateralis. Structures at risk: perforating branches of profunda femoris artery.

name: Thigh — Posterolateral approach
text: Posterolateral thigh approach: superficial interval between vastus lateralis and biceps femoris. Structures at risk: perforating branches of profunda femoris artery.

name: Thigh — Anteromedial approach
text: Anteromedial thigh approach: superficial interval between rectus femoris and vastus medialis. Structures at risk: medial superior geniculate artery; infrapatellar branch of the saphenous nerve.

name: Knee — Anterior (medial parapatellar)
text: Anterior knee (medial parapatellar) approach: interval through rectus femoris/vastus medialis, patella, and medial patellar retinaculum. Structure at risk: infrapatellar branch of saphenous nerve.

name: Knee — Medial approach
text: Medial knee approach: superficial interval through medial patellar retinaculum and sartorius. Structures at risk: saphenous nerve; medial collateral ligament (MCL).

name: Knee — Lateral approach
text: Lateral knee approach: superficial interval between IT band and biceps femoris. Structures at risk: common peroneal nerve; superior/inferior lateral geniculate artery; popliteus tendon; LCL.

name: Knee — Posterior approach
text: Posterior knee approach: superficial interval between semimembranosus, biceps femoris, and lateral head of gastrocnemius. Structures at risk: popliteal artery; tibial nerve; peroneal nerve; medial sural cutaneous nerve.

name: Leg — Lateral approach
text: Lateral leg approach: superficial interval between gastrocnemius/soleus/FHL and peroneus longus/brevis. Structures at risk: lesser saphenous vein; superficial peroneal nerve.

name: Leg — Medial approach
text: Medial leg approach: superficial interval between gastrocnemius and soleus and tibia. Structures at risk: posterior tibial artery; saphenous nerve and vein.

name: Ankle — Anterior approach
text: Anterior ankle approach: interval between EHL and tibialis anterior (or EDL). Structures at risk: superficial/deep peroneal nerves; anterior tibial artery.

name: Ankle — Posteromedial approach
text: Posteromedial ankle approach: interval between tibialis posterior/FDL/FHL and Achilles tendon. Structures at risk: saphenous nerve and vein.

name: Ankle — Posterolateral approach
text: Posterolateral ankle approach: superficial interval between peroneus brevis and Achilles tendon; deep interval between peroneus brevis and FHL. Structures at risk: sural nerve; small saphenous vein.
